totalisations.description: Totals that relate to the penalties that HMRC has levied.

lateSubmissionPenaltyTotalValue.description: Total value of all unpaid late submission penalties. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

penalisedPrincipalTotal.description: Total value of Value Added Tax (VAT) owed before penalties and interest. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

latePaymentPenaltyPostedTotal.description: Total value of Late Payment Penalty (LPP) charged. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

latePaymentPenaltyEstimateTotal.description: Estimated total value of uncharged Late Payment Penalty (LPP) with amount accruing. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

lateSubmissionPenalty.description: Information about the late submission penalties that HMRC has levied.

summary.description: A summary of the individual's or organisation's late submission penalty status.

activePenaltyPoints.description: Number of active penalty points held for failure to submit on time.

periodOfComplianceAchievement.description: This is the date that penalty points expire if customer meets requirements.

regimeThreshold.description: Total number of penalty points required to generate a financial penalty.

penaltyChargeAmount.description: Total amount charged per penalty after reaching threshold. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

details.description: Details of each late submission penalty that the individual or organisation has accrued.

penaltyNumber.description: This is used to identify the penalty points received within a set period.

penaltyOrder.description: Used to sort penalty points in order of the date the customer received the penalty.

penaltyCategory.description: This shows the category of the penalty object.

oneOf.description: The penalty represents a point that has not met the threshold for a charge.

The penalty represents a charge that has been levied because the point threshold has been exceeded. Although this penalty will not be added to the point total because the threshold has already been met, it will affect the period of compliance.
The penalty represents a point that has met the threshold for a charge. The penalty thus consists of a point and a charge.

penaltyStatus.description: Shows if the penalty has been paid, or not been paid.

oneOf.description: If the penalty category is 'point', it counts towards the individual's or organisation's point balance. If the penalty category is 'threshold', it counts towards the individual's or organisation's point balance. It has also triggered a penalty charge. If the penalty category is 'charge', then it represents a charge that has been levied because the threshold has been exceeded.

If the penalty category is 'point', it no longer counts towards the individual's or organisation's point balance. This might be because the point has expired, been successfully appealed against, or been removed due to an adjustment. If the penalty category is 'threshold', then it no longer counts towards the individual's or organisation's point balance for the same reasons. Alternatively, a 'threshold' penalty could be inactive because the charge that is associated with it has been reversed. If the penalty category is 'charge', then the charge has been reversed.

frequencyAdjustmentPointIndicator.description: Indicates if there's been an adjustment to your penalty point because of a change to your submission frequency. For example, changing from quarterly submissions to monthly submissions.

penaltyCreationDate.description: Date that the penalty point was created.

penaltyExpiryDate.description: This is the date a penalty point will expire. If penalty points fall into a threshold, it will expire once compliance is met.

expiryReason.description: The reason why a penalty point has expired.

oneOf.description: The penalty point has expired due to a successful appeal.
The penalty point has expired due to a change in the user's submission frequency.
A change has resulted in the user's obligations being reversed. For example, a user might have deregistered for VAT before a submission was due.
An HMRC officer has removed the penalty. This might happen, for example, following a decision made by a tribunal.
The penalty point has expired naturally. For example, it has reached the end of its 24-month lifetime.
The penalty has been removed because the submission was deemed to be on time.
The penalty point has expired because the user has met the conditions for the expiry of all active penalty points.
An HMRC officer has reset the user's penalty points to zero.

communicationsDate.description: This is the date that letters about a penalty are sent to users.

lateSubmissions.description: The late submissions that relate to the period for which the penalty was levied. Note that although only one penalty point will be levied for late submissions of a particular type of obligation during a calendar month, more than one late submission of that type could be made during the month. In that case, the lateSubmissions array will contain more than one object. All of these late submissions are incorporated within the single penalty point and affect the period of compliance and expiry date (which will be set by the date of the most recent failure).

lateSubmissionID.description: Late Submission Identification linked to the penalty.

taxPeriod.description: Tax period one failed to submit.

taxReturnStatus.description: This shows the status of a tax return.

taxPeriodStartDate.description: Start date of the obligation period for the penalty.

taxPeriodEndDate.description: End date of the obligation period for the penalty.

taxPeriodDueDate.description: Tax period due date that a failed submission happened.

returnReceiptDate.description: The date a VAT return submission was made.

appealInformation.description: Details of any appeals that the individual or organisation has made against the penalty point.

appealStatus.description: The appeal status of a penalty.

chargeReference.description: The late submission penalty charge reference.

chargeAmount.description: Total amount of Late Submission Penalty (LSP) charge. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

chargeOutstandingAmount.description: Total amount remaining on the penalty that needs to be paid. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

chargeDueDate.description: Late Submission Penalty (LSP) charge due date (30 days max)

latePaymentPenalty.description: Information about the late payment penalties that HMRC has levied.

details.description: Details of all the late payment penalties that the individual or organisation has accrued.

principalChargeReference.description: The reference for the principal charge upon which the late payment penalty is based. This is the original charge that was not paid on time.

penaltyCategory.description: This shows if the penalty is LPP (Type 1) or an additional penalty (Type 2).

penaltyStatus.description: This is used to show the status of the penalty.

penaltyAmountAccruing.description: Total amount to be paid on penalty. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

penaltyAmountPosted.description: Total amount to be paid on penalty. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

penaltyAmountPaid.description: Amount of the penalty that has already been paid. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

penaltyAmountOutstanding.description: Remaining amount on penalty to be paid. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

latePaymentPenalty1LowerRateCalculationA.description: Amount of unpaid tax on day 16, after the due date. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

latePaymentPenalty1LowerRatePercentage.description: The percentage used to calculate the lower rate part of the penalty.

latePaymentPenalty1HigherRateCalculation.description: Amount of unpaid tax on day 31, after the due date. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

latePaymentPenalty1HigherRatePercentage.description: The percentage used to calculate the higher rate part of the penalty.

latePaymentPenalty2Days.description: The number of days since day 31 of the late penalty payment.

latePaymentPenalty2Percentage.description: The rate applied to unpaid tax to calculate the penalty payment.

penaltyChargeCreationDate.description: This is the date when the penalty charge was created.

communicationsDate.description: This is the date a letter was sent to the customer.

penaltyChargeReference.description: The late payment penalty charge reference.

penaltyChargeDueDate.description: This is the date the penalty must be paid by.

appealStatus.description: The appeal status of a penalty.

principalChargeDocNumber.description: Document number relating to VAT charge

principalChargeMainTransaction.description: Used to identify the type of charge.

principalChargeSubTransaction.description: Used to identify the type of charge that the penalty was applied to.

timeToPay.description: Details of the Time to Pay arrangement that has been made.

timeToPayStartDate.description: This is the start date of the agreed time to pay the charge.

timeToPayEndDate.description: This is the last date of the agreed time to pay the charge.
